reviewText: Good effects, but I don't really like the blue people story stuff too much.
Amazing time. Top 5 of all time. I loved the honey scene.
I liked Frankenstein because the monster was blue, and I didn’t like Frankenstein because they play really sappy music at the end

I liked the character-driven approach of one battle after another, and the acting was all great. The long shots during the ending car-chase scene were a great western touch. Leonardo de Caprio’s character falling off a tree will always be pretty funny
I like the songs in Kpop demon hunters and the animation was pretty good for having a low budget
My review of Weapons is I didn’t finish it because I thought is was a bit boring
I liked the bit when the kids tore the woman to shreds. However, as well-made as it was, I think they spoiled "the twist" a bit too early on, and so the rest of the movie felt a bit underwhelming.

I really loved Sinners. It’s intense, confident, and way more emotionally grounded than I expected. What stuck with me most is how clearly the film understands that “sin” isn’t neutral—race shapes who gets sympathy, who gets forgiveness, and who’s condemned from the jump.
The movie does a great job showing how Black characters are constantly watched, judged, and read as guilty, even in moments of vulnerability. There’s this ongoing tension between being seen and being surveilled, between confession as honesty and confession as something dangerous. None of it feels preachy—the racial themes are baked into the story, the performances, and even how the camera moves.
